pr_title: Make sure that Funqy types are registered for reflection

timeline.bodyText:
If the return type Uni<T> doesn't this register whole Uni<T>  instead of just T?
We do some processing related to this in FunctionInvoker.
If possible maybe registration of FunctionInvoker::inputType and FunctionInvoker::outputType should be sufficient.
timeline.author: matejvasek

replies.bodyText: I'll check it out later on today or tomorrow morning
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
PR updated to exclude Mutiny types (the generics types do get registered however).
We don't need the output of FunctionInvoker::inputType or FunctionInvoker::outputType as we already know the types that need to be registered at build time by just looking at the method signatures (same as RESTEasy)
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message:
Make sure that Funqy types are registered for reflection

Done in a way very similar to what we do for RESTEasy

Fixes: #12019

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think so. It should be in the RESTEasy ones though.
Basically, we need to ignore them if we have some special handling for them, which is the case for RESTEasy.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: I don't see us ignoring the Mutiny types in RESTEasy, or perhaps I am just missing something?
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: Yeah, what I was saying is that we probably should. And definitely not do it in the generic ReflectiveHierarchyBuildItem.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Okay, I'll update the PR later on
replies.author: geoand
